I’m guessing b, maybe a too :P[/quote]

I just ripped it from my other cache reader, of course I didn’t write it. Youd have to have balls to say you did. And actually I did repackage it for a reason.

item.title: UBZIP2 Profile
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Taharok:

I’m failing to understand why you’re actually working directly on the BZIP2 implementation. The algorithm itself is slow, not the code Apache provided. Unrolling the algorithm doesn’t necessarily make it faster; if anything, it’ll be slower because it’s a larger method that needs to be interpreted/stored in the processor cache/RAM. You’re giving the processor more instructions to execute at one time, to perform the same function.

Cache files in the modern cache format are compressed using either a BZIP2 or GZIP algorithm. I can’t change the implementation and that is a bit depressing to hear, but I guess if there is nothing I can do then there is nothing I can do.

Read full topic

Unrolling the algorithm doesn’t necessarily make it faster; if anything, it’ll be slower because it’s a larger method that needs to be interpreted/stored in the processor cache/RAM. You’re giving the processor more instructions to execute at one time, to perform the same function.

item.title: UBZIP2 Profile
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:3, topic:425255”][code=java]private void simpleSort(int lo, int hi, int d) {
int i, j, h, bigN, hp;
int v;

    bigN = hi - lo + 1;
    if (bigN < 2) {
        return;
    }

    hp = 0;
    while (incs[hp] < bigN) {
        hp++;
    }
    hp--;

    for (; hp >= 0; hp--) {
        h = incs[hp];

        i = lo + h;
        while (true) {
            /* copy 1 */
            if (i > hi) {
                break;
            }
            v = zptr[i];
            j = i;
            while (fullGtU(zptr[j - h] + d, v + d)) {
                zptr[j] = zptr[j - h];
                j = j - h;
                if (j <= (lo + h - 1)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            zptr[j] = v;
            i++;

            /* copy 2 */
            if (i > hi) {
                break;
            }
            v = zptr[i];
            j = i;
            while (fullGtU(zptr[j - h] + d, v + d)) {
                zptr[j] = zptr[j - h];
                j = j - h;
                if (j <= (lo + h - 1)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            zptr[j] = v;
            i++;

            /* copy 3 */
            if (i > hi) {
                break;
            }
            v = zptr[i];
            j = i;
            while (fullGtU(zptr[j - h] + d, v + d)) {
                zptr[j] = zptr[j - h];
                j = j - h;
                if (j <= (lo + h - 1)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            zptr[j] = v;
            i++;

            if (workDone > workLimit && firstAttempt) {
                return;
            }
        }
    }
}

[/code]
Did you try it without modification (directly from apache above) and see if the issue is with your unrolling or something? I cba to look at that mountain and try and find a problem, but if it was me I usually just do the typical debug steps by changing one thing at a time until I find the issue.

Though if I may ask, why are you using the apache code in the first place, what is your purpose?[/quote]

Cache editor API. I will look into it, and yes I agree the if statements are a mind fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: UBZIP2 Profile
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[code=java]private void simpleSort(int lo, int hi, int d) {
int i, j, h, bigN, hp;
int v;

    bigN = hi - lo + 1;
    if (bigN < 2) {
        return;
    }

    hp = 0;
    while (incs[hp] < bigN) {
        hp++;
    }
    hp--;

    for (; hp >= 0; hp--) {
        h = incs[hp];

        i = lo + h;
        while (true) {
            /* copy 1 */
            if (i > hi) {
                break;
            }
            v = zptr[i];
            j = i;
            while (fullGtU(zptr[j - h] + d, v + d)) {
                zptr[j] = zptr[j - h];
                j = j - h;
                if (j <= (lo + h - 1)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            zptr[j] = v;
            i++;

            /* copy 2 */
            if (i > hi) {
                break;
            }
            v = zptr[i];
            j = i;
            while (fullGtU(zptr[j - h] + d, v + d)) {
                zptr[j] = zptr[j - h];
                j = j - h;
                if (j <= (lo + h - 1)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            zptr[j] = v;
            i++;

            /* copy 3 */
            if (i > hi) {
                break;
            }
            v = zptr[i];
            j = i;
            while (fullGtU(zptr[j - h] + d, v + d)) {
                zptr[j] = zptr[j - h];
                j = j - h;
                if (j <= (lo + h - 1)) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            zptr[j] = v;
            i++;

            if (workDone > workLimit && firstAttempt) {
                return;
            }
        }
    }
}

[/code]
Did you try it without modification (directly from apache above) and see if the issue is with your unrolling or something? I cba to look at that mountain and try and find a problem, but if it was me I usually just do the typical debug steps by changing one thing at a time until I find the issue.

Though if I may ask, why are you using the apache code in the first place, what is your purpose?

Read full topic
